HarvardHand Class Reference

A special hand with a clutch mechanism in each finger that allows the outer joint to continue to close after the inner link is stopped. More...

Detailed Description

A special hand with a clutch mechanism in each finger that allows the outer joint to continue to close after the inner link is stopped.

double  speedFactor = 1.0 
)

returns the max unbalanced force when this robot grasps the object

ColReportT HarvardHand::forceDOFTo ( double *  desiredDOFVals  )  [protected]

Calls the moveDOFTo in the robot class, but if any of the inner links are stopped by a contact, this will call the breakaway routine of the associate HarvardHandDOF.

void HarvardHand::fwdKinematics ( double *  dofVals,
std::vector< transf > &  trVec,
int  chainNum 
) [virtual]

This overrides the original fwdKinematics so that the correct values are used when one or more fingers have broken away.

Reimplemented from Robot.

int HarvardHand::load ( QString  filename  )  [virtual]

Performs the usual robot load, but replaces 3 of the DOF's with HarvardHandDOF's

make all DOF's point to HarvardHandDOF

QTextStream & HarvardHand::readDOFVals ( QTextStream &  is  )  [virtual]

Since the hand posture may be saved while one or more joints have broken away, it must read in ALL joint values.
